    Concrete Poster

    Raimund Abraham was an architect who has built very few buildings. Most of his work was academic, critical of the discipline, and often exists solely as drawings.

    In a way, this reveals that architecture is about manipulating form and space through drawing, rather than constructing buildings. Graphic design is comfortable with two-dimensional drawing, but what if form and material violated the design and made demands on what is possible?

    last updated February 20, 2016
